page.title: 17Chorley Housing Developments
page.content: The housing development in Astley village is mostly under ten years old. One of the oldest buildings in that area is Buckshaw Primary school and the newest part is Wymundsley where the houses are between 1 and 5 years old.The other roads in Astley village are Judland, Merefield, Deerfold, The Farthings, Long Copse, Great Meadow, Studfold and Threlfall. The residences are a mixture of private housing, council housing and flats. There is also some sheltered accomodation for the elderly. The community centre on the development is used by people of all ages and numerous organisations hire it. The organisations are; Guides, Brownies, Cubs, Scouts, Youth Club, PlaySchool, Toddler Group, Church and Sunday School.
